video.title: Network Programming with Python Course (build a port scanner, mailing client, chat room, DDOS)
video.description:
Learn network programming in Python by building four projects. You will learn to build a mailing client, a DDOS script, a port scanner, and a TCP Chat Room.

🎥 This course was developed by Neural Nine. Check out their YouTube channel: https://www.youtube.com/c/NeuralNine

⭐️ Course Contents ⭐️
⌨️ (00:00) Intro
⌨️ (00:37) Mailing Client
⌨️ (13:41) DDOS Script
⌨️ (27:29) Port Scanner
⌨️ (44:06) TCP Chat Room

--

Learn to code for free and get a developer job: https://www.freecodecamp.org

Read hundreds of articles on programming: https://freecodecamp.org/news

topLevelComment.author: NeuralNine
topLevelComment.text: Thanks to everyone for watching! I hope it was educational and easy to understand. If you are interested in more tutorials about programming, machine learning and computer science in general, you can check out my channel. The teaching style is the same and there is a lot more to come! :)

topLevelComment.author: Spaze Asterix
topLevelComment.text:
If you are having problems with the first project (Mailing Client), notably a "TimeoutError" or "smtplib.SMTPNotSupportedError: SMTP AUTH extension not supported by server" may I please suggest:

1. For initializing the SMTP port connection, use the code:
server = smtplib.SMTP(server_address,25)
server.ehlo()
server.starttls()
server.ehlo()

2. Do not use a gmail account as the sender email. Special security features in Gmail do not permit third party applications (less secure apps) to authenticate with just your login password and email.

topLevelComment.author: Fellakneezz
topLevelComment.text:
(for the DDOS) Wouldn't it be better if you opened the socket before the loop
Then closed it after
Because every loop you're dealing with the overhead of opening and closing a socket every time you make a request

topLevelComment.author: Rafy-Ivan Morales
topLevelComment.text:
I did write the code like it is and this is what it gives me, any suggestions?

Exception in thread Thread-1:
Traceback (most recent call last):
  File "/usr/lib/python3.9/threading.py", line 954, in _bootstrap_inner
    self.run()
  File "/usr/lib/python3.9/threading.py", line 892, in run
    self._target(*self._args, **self._kwargs)
  File "/home/kali/PycharmProjects/pythonProject1/portscan-nmap.py", line 28, in worker
    if portscan(port):
TypeError: 'module' object is not callable
Open ports are:  []
Traceback (most recent call last):
  File "/home/kali/PycharmProjects/pythonProject1/portscan-nmap.py", line 43, in <module>
    thread.start()
  File "/usr/lib/python3.9/threading.py", line 869, in start
    raise RuntimeError("threads can only be started once")
RuntimeError: threads can only be started once

topLevelComment.author: Rafy-Ivan Morales
topLevelComment.text:
I want to ask for help....I need to make a program  with Python program that should test the given host and it should generate a list of

all the TCP Open ports within the range of 1 to 1025. You are required to accomplish this task by using

standard Python’s “socket” library. Following are the functional requirements:

1. On execution of program system should prompt “Enter a host to scan”. User will provide a host

name

2. System should look for all the ports between the range of 1 to 1025

3. If the Ports is open it should create a file and add an entry for port number

4. In case of any exception for instance “host is not available”, “host name could not be resolved” or

due to any other error you need to write that exception into same file

5. You also need to record starting and ending date and time at the beginning and ending of file

accordingly. It should also show the total time it took in port scanning process

topLevelComment.author: Neko Emiyo
topLevelComment.text: For anyone having issues who are trying to use a GMAIL(or another mail provider), I needed to change one line to "server = smtplib.SMTP_SSL('smtp.gmail.com',465)" since most mail NEEDS to be encrypted and if u use google, turn on "less secure apps in Google account security, otherwise itll block the attempt and yell at u

topLevelComment.author: Rajesh Alluri
topLevelComment.text:
Am getting this error:

login raise SMTPNotSupportedError(
smtplib.SMTPNotSupportedError: SMTP AUTH extension not supported by server.

import smtplib

from email.mime.text import MIMEText
from email.mime.multipart import MIMEMultipart

server = smtplib.SMTP('smtp.gmail.com', 25)
server.ehlo()

with open('password.txt', 'r') as f:
	password = f.read()

server.login('mymail@mail.com', password)

message = MIMEMultipart()
message['From'] = 'Dev'
message['To'] = 'testmail@gmail.com'
message['Subject'] = 'Test.'

with open('body.txt', 'r') as f:
	body = f.read()

message.attach(MIMEText(body, 'plain'))

text = message.as_string()
server.sendmail('mail@gmail.com', 'testmail@gmail.com', text)

Don't mind the mail ids. I have changed the original mail ids
